TextBody:
Hello,

Thank you for your reply.
I add below the steps for collecting logs from a MacOS EPP machine:
 
1. Open terminal and run :
sudo touch /private/var/log/eppclient.log
sudo touch /private/var/log/eppsslsplit.log
 
sudo launchctl unload /Library/LaunchDaemons/com.cososys.eppclient.launchdaemon.plist
sudo launchctl load /Library/LaunchDaemons/com.cososys.eppclient.launchdaemon.plist
 
2. Press on the EPP Client Icon option 'Update policies now' and then reproduce the problematic scenario.
  + Run in a terminal (this will copy the files to desktop):
cp /private/var/log/eppclient.log ~/Desktop
cp /private/var/log/eppsslsplit.log ~/Desktop
cp /etc/epp/reprovision.db ~/Desktop
cp /etc/epp/rights.s3db ~/Desktop
cp /etc/epp/netdlp/netdlp_settings.json ~/Desktop
 
3. Send us an archive with eppclient.log, eppsslsplit.log, reprovision.db, rights.s3db and netdlp_settings.json files which are located on the Desktop.

Best regards,
Alin Anca

Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix - DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
CoSoSys Ltd www.endpointprotector.com

TextBody:
Hello,

I hope you are well.
My colleagues have analyzed the logs and mentioned that this is a limitation on the client side, and that formats such as ACE, bz2, xz, xar are not supported by EPP client to be scanned by contents. For the rest of compressed formats (.rar, .tar, .gz, .zip) we can see that the compressed were scanned successfully and a block was performed.

Best regards,

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000KZmCj:ref

And does the fact that scanning is not supported due to client-side limitations mean that I created the policy incorrectly? I reinstalled EPP to send the logs, and I only created the CAP policy for testing.
Subject: Netwrix Support Ticket #431950 - Issue with Compressed Files Not Being Blocked or Logged in Content Aware Protection (CAP) Policy

TextBody:
Hello,

Thank you for your reply.
Some archive formats are supported (like .zip, .gz), these are scanned by contents. The other unsupported formats are not scanned by contents.

The checkboxes related to ACE/xz/etc refer to the mimetype. So, when a file is determined to be an ACE archive, even if we do not support scanning the contents, we know that it is an ACE archive and the policy could choose to block ACE archives.

Best regards,
Alin Anca

Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix - DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
CoSoSys Ltd www.endpointprotector.com

For example, with a zip file:
      1.    I did not check the checkbox for blocking zip archive files.
      2.    Inside the zip archive, there are files such as pdf, jpg, and gif.
      3.    I have checked the checkboxes to block pdf, jpg, and gif files.
      4.    pdf and jpg files are blocked, but gif files are not blocked.

Even if I do not check the option to block zip files, it still gets blocked because of the contents inside.
However, some files are blocked, and some are not.

Additionally, for archive files like 7z or rar, there are checkboxes available, but none of them are blocked.

Do you understand what I mean?
And please explain it in a simpler way.

I checked the Netwrix user manual, but there is no proper explanation of what a MIME type is.

Please do not forget that I am asking because the archive file is recognized, and even when I select to block both the archive file and its contents, it is not being blocked

I reinstalled EPP to send the logs, and I only created the CAP policy for testing.[https://nwxcorp.my.salesforce.com/servlet/servlet.ImageServer?oid=00D7000000091pB&esid=018Qk00000K7rk1&from=ext]

TextBody:
Hello,

MIME type refers to the FIle type. For example, if you select text file MIME type, the policy blocks .txt files without checking the contents.
In the same way, if you select a ZIP MIME type, .zip files will be blocked without checking the contents.
If ZIP MIME type is not selected, we still access the archive to check its content. ( ex. If the text file MIME type is selected and present in the zip fil,e it will be blocked.)
Epp can do this for .rar, .tar, .gz and .zip archives.
For other archives it is not possible to check the contents, but we can still see the archive type and block it if you have the respective MIME type selected.

You mentioned gif files are not seen in the zip file. Can you please confirm if you tested this when collecting the logs?


Kind regards
__________________
Andrei Pop | Technical Support Engineer
Netwrix Endpoint Protector

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000KZmCj:ref

Yes, not only GIF but other files were also not visible.
When I sent the logs, the method I tested was as follows:
I created files for (csv, xlsx, pptx, docx, eml, gif, bmp, pdf, txt, ico, pub, webp) one by one and then compressed them into (zip, 7z, ace, rar, tar, bz2, gz, xz, xar) archive files for testing.

ex)
zip - csv, xlsx, pptx, docx, eml, gif, bmp, pdf, txt, ico, pub, webp
7z - csv, xlsx, pptx, docx, eml, gif, bmp, pdf, txt, ico, pub, webp

I created and tested them like this.

This is the issue I encountered:
For example, when I tested with all the file types checked but not checking the zip file type, I found that csv, xlsx, pptx, docx files were shown as blocked in the logs, but gif, bmp, and pdf were not shown as blocked. (This is an example; the actual blocked files may need to be reviewed.)

And

Is MIME type just used to indicate the file type?
For file types other than .rar, .tar, .gz, and .zip, does it mean content cannot be checked?
Subject: Netwrix Support Ticket #431950 - Issue with Compressed Files Not Being Blocked or Logged in Content Aware Protection (CAP) Policy

TextBody:
Hello,

Thank you for the information.
We will cehck this and get back to you.

Is MIME type just used to indicate the file type?
- Yes.
For file types other than .rar, .tar, .gz, and .zip, does it mean content cannot be checked?
The content will not be checked because the file will be blocked based on its type. If the file is blocked, there is no need to check the content.

Kind regards
__________________
Andrei Pop | Technical Support Engineer
Netwrix Endpoint Protector
